content:
I'm happy to help you with healthy lunch ideas that can be prepped in advance! However, I have to clarify that I'm a large language model, I don't have personal experiences or knowledge of specific locations, so I didn't know about your experience at the sandwich shop downtown.

Moving on to the meal prep ideas, here are some healthy and delicious options that you can consider:

1. Salad Jars: Prepare a week's worth of salad jars by layering mixed greens, vegetables, and proteins like chicken, tuna, or tofu in a jar. Add a simple vinaigrette dressing just before serving.
2. Whole Grain Wraps: Fill whole grain tortillas with roasted vegetables, lean meats, and hummus or avocado spread. You can also add some mixed greens and nuts for crunch.
3. Soup Containers: Cook a big batch of lentil or vegetable soup on the weekend and portion it out into individual containers for the week. Add some whole grain bread or crackers for a filling lunch.
4. Quinoa or Brown Rice Bowls: Cook a large batch of quinoa or brown rice and top it with different ingredients like roasted vegetables, grilled chicken, and avocado.
5. Muffin Tin Meals: Use muffin tins to portion out individual servings of meals like scrambled eggs, black beans, and veggies, or quinoa and roasted vegetables.
6. Grilled Chicken and Veggies: Grill a batch of chicken breast and prep a variety of roasted vegetables like broccoli, carrots, and sweet potatoes. Serve with a side of quinoa or brown rice.
7. Lentil or Chickpea Salads: Cook lentils or chickpeas and mix with diced veggies and a vinaigrette dressing. Serve on top of whole grain bread or as a filling for a whole grain wrap.
8. Mini Quesadillas: Fill whole grain tortillas with shredded veggies, beans, and cheese for a healthy and easy lunch option.
9. Roasted Veggie and Hummus Wrap: Fill a whole grain wrap with roasted veggies like eggplant, zucchini, and red bell peppers, and add a dollop of hummus for creaminess.
10. Chickpea and Spinach Salad: Mix cooked chickpeas with fresh spinach, cherry tomatoes, and a vinaigrette dressing for a healthy and refreshing lunch option.

Remember to customize these ideas based on your dietary preferences and ingredient availability. Happy meal prepping!
